title: Two suspects arrested over Wennappuwa shooting incident
byline: Two more suspects have been arrested in connection with the shooting incident reported in Wennappuwa on Sunday (31), police said.

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department states that several spells of showers will occur in Sabaragamuwa province and in Kandy, Nuwara-Eliya districts.

title: Govt to launch “Seiri Week” today to dispose of unnecessary items accumulated in state institutions
byline: The government has taken steps to implement a special program starting today (September 1) to dispose of unnecessary items that have accumulated in all state institutions.

title: Hamas spokesman Abu Obeida killed in Gaza, Israel says
byline: Abu Obeida, the spokesman for Hamas’s armed wing, has been killed in an aerial attack in Gaza City, Israel has said.

title: 6.3 magnitude earthquake hits Afghanistan, at least 20 killed
byline: A powerful earthquake measuring 6.3 on the Richter scale struck Afghanistan late Sunday night, leaving at least 20 people dead, according to BBC reports.

title: Psychiatrist warns of rising youth violence linked to social media
byline: Specialist Psychiatrist Dr. Rumi Ruben of Karapitiya National Hospital has warned that young people are increasingly turning to violent behavior influenced by social media.

title: Former Presidential Secretary Saman Ekanayake asked not to appear before CID today
byline: UPDATE: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has informed former President’s Secretary Saman Ekanayake that it is not necessary for him to appear before the CID today, according to the former President Ranil Wickremesinghe’s Media Division.

title: Seat belts mandatory for expressway bus passengers from today
byline: It has been made mandatory for passengers traveling in passenger transport buses on expressways to wear seat belts starting today (September 1).

title: Child dies falling into irrigation well in Polpithigama
byline: A six-year-old boy has died after falling into an irrigation well in Polpithigama, police stated.

title: China’s Xi, Russia’s Putin share vision for new global order at security forum
byline: Chinese President Xi Jinping urged leaders at a regional summit to leverage their “mega-scale market” on Monday, while Russian President Vladimir Putin showed support for Xi’s ambition for a new global security and economic order that poses a challenge to the United States.

title: President Anura Kumara in Jaffna to inaugurate several development projects
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to participate today (01) in several events to inaugurate and commence work on new development projects in Jaffna.

title: Tesla cuts price for long-range RWD Model 3 in China
byline: Tesla Inc lowered the price for its Model 3 rear-wheel drive version in China by 3.7% to 259,500 yuan ($36,278.99), its website showed on Monday.

title: No bus fare revision despite reduction in fuel prices: NTC
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) has confirmed that bus fares will not be revised, despite the reduction in fuel prices announced yesterday (31).

title: Original Harry Potter cast reunion not happening, says Director Chris Columbus
byline: With the much-awaited Harry Potter TV series already in production, expectations have also swirled around a potential reunion of the original cast, including the likes of Daniel Radcliffe, Emma Watson, and Rupert Grint.

title: Two suspects arrested with ‘hashish’ worth Rs. 10million
byline: Two individuals have been arrested with a large consignment of ‘hashish’ worth approximately Rs. 10 million, the Mount Lavinia Divisional Crime Detective Bureau said.

title: Apple may expand eSIM-only iPhones in more countries this year
byline: Apple appears poised to expand its transition away from physical SIM card trays in its iPhones, with indications that more European countries will shift to eSIM technology this year.

title: U.S. widens visa ban on Palestinian passport holders
byline: The administration of US President Donald Trump has broadened its visa restrictions on Palestinian passport holders, halting approvals for nearly all categories of non-immigrant visitor visas, according to multiple US outlets.

title: Ex-President Ranil extends his gratitude to all factions who stood by him
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has extended his gratitude to all factions who stood by him from the time of his arrest to his hospitalisation.

title: Colombo HC hears evidence against “Harak Kata” in robbery case
byline: The hearing of evidence in the case filed against the underworld figure Nadun Chinthaka Wickramaratne, alias “Harak Kata,” who is accused of breaking into a house in Meethotamulla and robbing a three-wheeler and Rs. 26,000 in cash, was held at the Colombo High Court today (01).

title: Committee to be named to provide proposals to improve standard of food offered in Parliament
byline: A decision has been taken to appoint a committee to provide recommendations to enhance the safety of food and beverages in Parliament.

title: Death toll in Afghanistan earthquake rises to over 600
byline: Update: Death toll in Afghanistan earthquake rises to over 600 while more than 1500 injured.

title: SC grants leave to proceed with FR against ex-President Ranil and others regarding Eppawala phosphate deposit
byline: The Supreme Court today (01) granted leave to proceed with a fundamental rights petition filed against former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, several former cabinet ministers, and other respondents.

title: No Laugfs Gas price revision in September
byline: LAUGFS Gas PLC has confirmed that there will be no price revision for domestic gas cylinder refills in the month of September, 2025.

title: Vehicular movement restricted between Devi Balika Roundabout and DS Senanayake Junction in Borella from 7pm
byline: Vehicular movement will be restricted from 7:00 p.m. today (01), on a stretch of the entry road to Colombo from the Devi Balika Roundabout to the D.S. Senanayake Junction with the Borella Police Division.

title: Ishara Sewwandi fled the country shortly after Ganemulla Sanjeewa’s murder: CID
byline: The CID has uncovered that ‘Ishara Sewwandi’, the fugitive female who alleged to have aided and abetted the murder of notorious underworld figure and drug trafficker Ganemulla Sanjeewa inside the Hulftsdorp Magistrate’s Court on February 19, 2025., has fled the country.

title: Police launch probe into ‘fake news’ and doctored images of Public Security Minister
byline: An investigation has been launched regarding the circulation of ‘fake news’ and doctored photographs on social media, which appear to falsely represent Minister Ananda Wijepala, the Police Headquarters stated.

title: “There is no longer a threat of war in the country” - President Anura Kumara
byline: There is no longer a threat of war in the country, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has stated while attending an event in Jaffna.

title: Indonesian politicians to have perks cut in bid to quell unrest
byline: Indonesian political parties have agreed to reverse some state-funded perks their politicians receive in a bid to quell nationwide protests, the country’s president has said.

title: Former Minister Udaya Gammanpila files petition to prevent arrest
byline: Former Minister Udaya Gammanpila has filed a petition before the Court of Appeal seeking an order to prevent his arrest under the provisions of the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights (ICCPR).
